crisis.description: Free, confidential crisis support for people in suicidal crisis or emotional distress

crisis.description: Free 24/7 crisis support via text message

mental_health.description: Online therapy with licensed therapists via messaging, video, or phone

mental_health.name: Talkspace
mental_health.description: Text and video therapy with licensed therapists

mental_health.name: Open Path Collective
mental_health.description: Network of therapists offering reduced-fee sessions

mental_health.name: NAMI Support Groups
mental_health.description: Free support groups for people with mental health conditions and their families

mental_health.name: SAMHSA National Helpline
mental_health.description: Treatment referral and information service for mental health and substance use disorders

mental_health.name: Psychology Today Therapist Finder
mental_health.description: Find therapists in your area by specialty, insurance, and approach

financial_help.name: National Foundation for Credit Counseling (NFCC)
financial_help.description: Nonprofit credit counseling, debt management, and financial education

financial_help.name: 211 Helpline
financial_help.description: Find local help with rent, food, utilities, and other essential needs

financial_help.name: Feeding America
financial_help.description: Locate food banks and pantries near you

financial_help.name: Benefits.gov
financial_help.description: Find government assistance programs you may qualify for (SNAP, housing, medical)

financial_help.name: National Debt Relief
financial_help.description: Negotiate with creditors to reduce debt amounts

financial_help.name: CareerOneStop
financial_help.description: Job search tools, career resources, and training programs

coping_strategies.name: 4-7-8 Breathing Exercise
coping_strategies.instructions:
1. Breathe in through your nose for 4 seconds
2. Hold your breath for 7 seconds
3. Exhale slowly through your mouth for 8 seconds
4. Repeat 3-4 times
coping_strategies.why_it_works: This technique activates your parasympathetic nervous system, which helps calm your body's stress response

coping_strategies.name: 5-4-3-2-1 Grounding Technique
coping_strategies.instructions:
Name out loud:
- 5 things you can see
- 4 things you can touch
- 3 things you can hear
- 2 things you can smell
- 1 thing you can taste
coping_strategies.why_it_works: Grounding brings you back to the present moment and interrupts anxious thoughts

coping_strategies.name: Box Breathing
coping_strategies.instructions:
1. Breathe in for 4 counts
2. Hold for 4 counts
3. Breathe out for 4 counts
4. Hold for 4 counts
5. Repeat 4-5 times
coping_strategies.why_it_works: Used by Navy SEALs to stay calm under pressure. Regulates breathing and heart rate

coping_strategies.name: Progressive Muscle Relaxation
coping_strategies.instructions:
1. Tense your feet muscles for 5 seconds, then release
2. Move up to calves, thighs, stomach, chest, arms, face
3. Focus on the difference between tension and relaxation
coping_strategies.why_it_works: Releases physical tension that accumulates from stress and anxiety

coping_strategies.name: Thought Challenging
coping_strategies.instructions:
When having a negative thought, ask:
1. What's the evidence for this thought?
2. What's the evidence against it?
3. What would I tell a friend thinking this?
4. What's a more balanced way to see this?
coping_strategies.why_it_works: Cognitive restructuring helps identify and change unhelpful thinking patterns

coping_strategies.name: TIPP Technique
coping_strategies.instructions:
Temperature: Splash cold water on your face
Intense exercise: Do jumping jacks for 1 minute
Paced breathing: Slow your breathing
Progressive relaxation: Tense and release muscles
coping_strategies.why_it_works: Quickly changes your body's physiological state to reduce emotional intensity

coping_strategies.name: Worry Time Scheduling
coping_strategies.instructions:
1. Set aside 15 minutes each day as 'worry time'
2. When worries come up during the day, write them down and save for worry time
3. During worry time, review and problem-solve your worries
4. When time is up, move on
coping_strategies.why_it_works: Gives you control over worrying instead of letting it control you

coping_strategies.name: Journaling for Mental Health
coping_strategies.instructions:
Write freely about:
- What you're feeling and why
- Things you're grateful for
- Problems you're facing and possible solutions
- Accomplishments, even small ones
coping_strategies.why_it_works: Writing helps process emotions and gain perspective on problems
